verb.description: Recognize or ascertain what makes (someone or something) different.
examples: children can differentiate the past from the present

verb.description: Make or become different in the process of growth or development.
examples: the receptors are developed and differentiated into sense organs
the cells differentiate into a wide variety of cell types

origin: Early 19th century: from medieval Latin differentiat- carried away from, from the verb differentiare, from differentia (see differentia).
